description.narrative: Taking it to the Ground - Peacebuilding through a Local Government Approach. Peacebuilding efforts often produce disappointing results for sustainable peace. Answering to a common critic of shallowness, this project will study the experience and possibility of explicitly grounding peacebuilding efforts in the local government context. Previous research shows a relative absence of such an approach, but it also tentatively shows a positive impact when it has been pursued. Working with a structured multiple case-study approach, the three cases focus on: i) nature of local government reform in light of sustainable peace; ii) the impact of local government on peacebuilding, statebuilding and deepened democracy; iii) the policies that lead to the attained impact. The overall aim is to draw conclusions of relevance both for policy and theory-building regarding the grounding and localizing of peacebuilding efforts and the possible effects that it might have.
